newsitem.title: USA: Fensome resigns as Arrow Air president.
newsitem.headline: Fensome resigns as Arrow Air president.

text.p: Terence Fensome, president and chief executive officer of Arrow Air Inc, has resigned after only eight months in his position, the acting president told Reuters Wednesday.
"He is leaving to pursue other interests," Jon Batchelor, senior vice president of international sales, said.
Batchelor will take over as acting president until Fensome's replacement is hired. Batchelor had been president for two years prior to Fensome taking the job.
Arrow is owned by International Air Leases Inc of Hialeah, Florida. Arrow and International Air were founded by Jon Batchelor's father, George Batchelor.
